title: Indian Navy Orientation & Current Affairs 2025
description: Comprehensive test covering basic Navy knowledge and current developments up to 2025

questions.text: When was the Royal Indian Navy re-designated as the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: The Royal Indian Navy was re-designated as Indian Navy on 26 January 1950 when India became a Republic.

questions.text: Which was the first aircraft carrier commissioned in the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: INS Vikrant was commissioned in February 1961, adding integral air defence and strike capability to the Indian Navy.

questions.text: In which operation were Indian Naval ships deployed for the first time?
questions.explanation: Indian Naval Ships were deployed for operations for the first time in the liberation of Goa in December 1961.

questions.text: What is the highest rank in the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: Admiral of the Fleet is the highest rank in the Indian Navy, equivalent to Field Marshal in Army and Marshal of the Air Force in Air Force.

questions.text: How many operational commands does the Indian Navy have?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy has two operational commands: Western Naval Command (Mumbai) and Eastern Naval Command (Visakhapatnam).

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a wing of the National Cadet Corps?
questions.explanation: The NCC has three wings: Army Wing, Navy Wing, and Air Force Wing. Coast Guard is a separate service.

questions.text: What is the motto of the National Cadet Corps?
questions.explanation: The NCC motto is 'Unity and Discipline' (Ekta aur Anushasan), reflecting the core values of the organization.

questions.text: What is the primary role of an aircraft carrier in the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: An aircraft carrier serves as a floating airfield and its primary role is to operate aircraft and helicopters.

questions.text: Which ceremony is observed when Indian Naval Ships cross the Equator?
questions.explanation: The 'Crossing the Line' ceremony is observed whenever Indian Naval Ships cross the Equator.

questions.text: How many gun salutes are entitled to the President of India?
questions.explanation: The President of India is entitled to 21 gun salutes as per naval traditions.

questions.text: Which of the following is a training command of the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: Southern Naval Command (Kochi) is the training command where all training establishments are located.

questions.text: What does the term 'Colours' refer to in naval terminology?
questions.explanation: 'Colours' describes the National Flag and Naval Ensign flown on ships between 0800 hrs to sunset in harbour.

questions.text: Which class of ships in the Indian Navy is designed for landing tanks and troops directly onto beaches?
questions.explanation: LSTs (Landing Ship Tank) are specially constructed to beach on shore and offload tanks, troops and vehicles directly onto beaches.

questions.text: What is the equivalent rank of Lieutenant in the Indian Army?
questions.explanation: A Lieutenant in the Indian Navy is equivalent to a Captain in the Indian Army.

questions.text: What is the role of the Chief of Personnel (COP) in the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: The Chief of Personnel (COP) controls manning requirements and is responsible for recruitment, training, welfare and discipline of naval personnel.

questions.text: Which establishment serves as the Marine Engineering School for the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: INS Shivaji at Lonavala serves as the Marine Engineering School, Naval Engineering College and NBCD School.

questions.text: What is the significance of the 'Commissioning Pennant' on a naval ship?

options.a: Indicates the ship is ready for combat
options.c: Hoisted on commissioning day and remains until decommissioning
options.d: Signals the presence of a flag officer onboard

questions.explanation: The Commissioning Pennant is hoisted on the main mast on the day of commissioning and is not struck down until the ship is decommissioned.

questions.text: Which of the following is a primary function of survey ships in the Indian Navy?

options.c: Geographical survey of sea and coastal areas

questions.explanation: Survey ships carry out geographical survey of sea and coastal areas and prepare charts for navigation.

questions.text: What does the term 'Man and Cheer Ship' ceremony involve?

options.a: Lowering the national flag at sunset
options.c: Ships company standing on catwalks to receive dignitaries

questions.explanation: In 'Man and Cheer Ship' ceremony, the ship's company mans the ship standing on catwalks from foxle to Quarter deck facing towards the dignitary.

questions.text: What is the primary difference between Destroyers and Frigates in the Indian Navy?

options.a: Destroyers are larger and more heavily armed than Frigates
options.c: Destroyers are used only for training
options.d: Frigates carry aircraft while Destroyers do not

questions.explanation: Destroyers are larger, general-purpose fighting ships, while Frigates are smaller and primarily serve as escort ships.

questions.text: As of 2025, which aircraft carrier is the flagship of the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: INS Vikrant, India's first indigenous aircraft carrier, is currently the flagship of the Indian Navy as of 2025.

questions.text: How many operational commands does the Indian Navy currently have in 2025?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy currently operates 4 commands: Western, Eastern, Southern, and Andaman & Nicobar Command.

questions.text: Which new indigenous aircraft carrier is under construction as of 2025?
questions.explanation: INS Vishal, India's second indigenous aircraft carrier, is currently under construction with advanced capabilities.

questions.text: What is the current strength of the Indian Navy's submarine fleet in 2025?
questions.explanation: As of 2025, the Indian Navy operates 16-18 submarines including conventional and nuclear-powered vessels.

questions.text: Which new stealth frigate class has been recently inducted into the Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: Project 17A stealth frigates are the latest induction, featuring advanced stealth technology and weapon systems.

questions.text: What is the primary maritime reconnaissance aircraft currently used by Indian Navy?
questions.explanation: The P-8I Poseidon is the primary maritime reconnaissance aircraft, providing advanced anti-submarine and surveillance capabilities.

questions.text: Which new naval base has been developed on the eastern coast as a strategic asset?
questions.explanation: INS Rambilli is a new strategic naval base being developed on the eastern coast for enhanced operational capabilities.

questions.text: What is the current focus area for Indian Navy's modernization under 'Make in India'?
questions.explanation: The Navy's modernization heavily focuses on indigenous shipbuilding and systems under the 'Make in India' initiative.

questions.text: Which new missile system has been integrated into Indian Navy's destroyers recently?
questions.explanation: BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles have been successfully integrated into multiple naval platforms for enhanced strike capability.

questions.text: What is the current status of India's nuclear submarine program as of 2025?

options.b: Two SSBNs and one SSN operational

questions.explanation: India currently operates two SSBNs (Arihant class) and one SSN (Chakra class) in its nuclear submarine fleet.

questions.text: Which new naval helicopter has been inducted for anti-submarine warfare?
questions.explanation: The MH-60R Seahawk helicopters have been inducted to significantly enhance anti-submarine warfare capabilities.

questions.text: What is the Indian Navy's current focus in the Indian Ocean Region?
questions.explanation: Maritime Domain Awareness through enhanced surveillance and international cooperation is a key focus area in IOR.

questions.text: Which new unmanned system has the Indian Navy recently acquired?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy has acquired Sea Guardian drones for enhanced maritime surveillance and reconnaissance.

questions.text: What is the current strength of the Indian Navy's aircraft carrier fleet?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy currently operates 2 aircraft carriers: INS Vikramaditya and INS Vikrant.

questions.text: Which new indigenous destroyer class has been commissioned recently?
questions.explanation: Visakhapatnam-class destroyers are the latest indigenous destroyers with advanced capabilities.

questions.text: What is the Indian Navy's role in 'SAGAR' initiative?

options.a: Security and Growth for All in the Region

questions.explanation: SAGAR (Security and Growth for All in the Region) is India's maritime initiative where Navy plays a key role.

questions.text: Which new naval air station has been commissioned in the Andaman & Nicobar Islands?
questions.explanation: INS Kohassa is the new naval air station commissioned in the Andaman & Nicobar Islands.

questions.text: What is the current focus of Indian Navy's cyber security efforts?
questions.explanation: The Navy treats cyberspace as a critical warfare domain and has established dedicated cyber security commands.

questions.text: Which new corvette class has been designed for anti-submarine warfare?
questions.explanation: Kamorta-class corvettes are specifically designed for anti-submarine warfare operations.

questions.text: What is the Indian Navy's current approach to women's participation?
questions.explanation: Women are now granted permanent commission in all branches of the Indian Navy.

questions.text: Which new training establishment has been set up for naval aviation?
questions.explanation: The Naval Institute of Aeronautical Technology has been established for specialized naval aviation training.

questions.text: What is the current status of India's sea-based nuclear deterrent?
questions.explanation: India's sea-based nuclear deterrent is operational with the Arihant-class ballistic missile submarines.

questions.text: Which new satellite system supports Indian Navy's communications?
questions.explanation: GSAT-7 (Rukmini) is India's first dedicated military satellite supporting naval communications.

questions.text: What is the Indian Navy's current strength in terms of personnel?
questions.explanation: The Indian Navy currently has approximately 70,000 personnel including officers and sailors.

questions.text: Which new naval exercise has been initiated with African navies?
questions.explanation: Exercise IBSAMAR is a joint naval exercise between India, Brazil, and South Africa.

questions.text: What is the focus of Indian Navy's 'Digital Navy' initiative?
questions.explanation: The 'Digital Navy' initiative aims at complete digital transformation of naval operations and administration.

questions.text: Which new indigenous torpedo has been developed for submarines?
questions.explanation: Varunastra is the indigenous heavyweight torpedo developed for submarine operations.

questions.text: What is the current approach to coastal security post-26/11?
questions.explanation: A comprehensive multi-layered coastal security system involving Navy, Coast Guard, and marine police has been established.

questions.text: Which new naval facility has been developed in Mauritius?
questions.explanation: India has helped Mauritius establish coastal radar stations for enhanced maritime surveillance in the Indian Ocean Region.

questions.text: What is the Indian Navy's current approach to environmental conservation?
questions.explanation: The Navy has implemented comprehensive 'Green Initiatives' including waste management, renewable energy, and marine conservation.
